div.p: The tools that were provided from the technological standpoint--
on ANGEL and Blackboard and Elluminate session-- helped me.
They just enhanced my experience in the classroom.
At my convenience any time of night or day, if I couldn't sleep, if it was early
and the house was quiet, I could jump on, check my homework for the week, check my last grade
on my test, just have messages for the professor or other classmates.
It was just extremely accessible at my convenience, and that overall helped
to enhance my experience with the program.
WebAdvisor was fantastic.
I actually underutilized it in the beginning.
Once I found out all it had to offer, I was constantly checking on a date,
maybe checking my bill and the financial office, or checking my average.
Of course after the exams, I would check it a few times a day to see
where my final grade had come in.
I found the student email to be extremely helpful.
The instructors were accessible, they always got back within a couple of hours.
I worked on many, many group projects, so the email came in handy.
I could correspond with just the people in my group,
or if I had a question for the class, I could ask them.
And if somebody was leaving one of our courses, going into another , often it was not uncommon
to get an email from them asking, "Does anybody have this book.
I'd like to buy it."
So it really helped in all different ways.
